presets.shortdescription: Default OpenStreetMap Preset for Vespucci and JOSM
presets.description: General purpose OpenStreetMap preset for Vespucci and JOSM, based on the original JOSM version

list_entry.short_description: Robust Wheels: trekking bike, car, rickshaw
High Clearance: light duty off-road vehicle
0: Solid gravel/packed earth, no obstacles, wide curves
1: Some loose surface, small obstacles, wide curves
2: Much loose surface, large obstacles, easy hairpins
3: Slippery surface, large obstacles, tight hairpins
4: Loose surface or boulders, dangerous hairpins

list_entry.short_description: Plants that are leafless for a certain period during the year.
Plants that are never entirely without green foliage.
Plants that lose their foliage for a very short period, when old leaves fall off and new foliage growth is starting.
Plants that lose most, but not all, of their foliage for a fraction of the year.
Habitat with evergreen and deciduous vegetation.

list_entry.short_description: Robust Wheels: trekking bike, car, rickshaw
High Clearance: light duty off-road vehicle
Robust Wheels: trekking bike, car, rickshaw
High Clearance: light duty off-road vehicle
Usually a paved or heavily compacted hardcore surface
Usually an unpaved track with surface of gravel mixed with a varying amount of sand, silt, and clay
Even mixture of hard and soft materials
Almost always an unpaved track prominently with soil/sand/grass, but with some hard materials, or compressed materials
Almost always an unpaved track lacking hard materials, uncompacted, with surface of soil/sand/grass
Trail well cleared. Area flat or slightly sloped, no fall hazard
Trail with continuous line and balanced ascent. Terrain partially steep, fall hazard possible
exposed sites may be secured with ropes or chains, possible need to use hands for balance. Partly exposed sites with fall hazard, scree, pathless jagged rocks

list_entry.display_value: T4 - difficult, exposed, steep alpine trail
list_entry.short_description: sometimes need for hand use to get ahead. Terrain quite exposed, precarious grassy acclivities, jagged rocks, facile snow-free glaciers

list_entry.display_value: T5 - difficult alpine trail with climbing
list_entry.short_description: single plainly climbing up to second grade. Exposed, demanding terrain, jagged rocks, few dangerous glacier and snow

list_entry.display_value: T6 - hazardous alpine trail with climbing
list_entry.short_description: climbing up to second grade. Often very exposed, precarious jagged rocks, glacier with danger to slip and fall
Marked footpath in a parking lot
Footway sections that do not exist but are necessary for routing
Footway sections inside a crossing island
Access for back entrances and/or emergency access

combo.display_values: Blinker,Blink mode,Bus priority,Continuous green,Emergency,Ramp meter,Tram priority

label.text: For pedestrian crossings:
In case of traffic signals:
Used for local orientation, or for references.
Tags which are implied and do not need to be set are:
`access=no`, `foot=yes` and `bicycle=yes`
Tags which are implied and do not need to be set are:
`motor_vehicle=no`, `psv=yes`, `foot=yes` and `bicycle=yes`
The tag `foot=yes` is implied and does not need to be set.

label.text: A body of water, such as a lake or pond.
Line between the sea and land (with the water on the right side of the way).
Waterlogged area, either permanently or seasonally with vegetation.
Large area covered with mud.
A flat area of sand, gravel or pebble next to water.
An area of water mostly surrounded by land but with level connection to the ocean or a lake.
A prominent, elevated piece of land sticking out into the sea or large lake.

Pole Attributes:
Switch Attributes:

list_entry.short_description: Forts using a rise of elevation
Raised area of ground for a castle
A group of artillary (cannon) in a fixed fortification
Like a statue, but only showing the upper half of a person.
A commemorative sign, often mounted on a wall.
An upright slab engraved or painted with decorations or inscriptions.
A stone with an inscription, picture, or similar.
A building, monument, statue or other edifice celebrating a victory or commemorating those who died or were injured in a war.
A non figurative sculpture which does not match any of the other categories.
A blue plaque commemorating a historical link to that location. (UK)
A bicycle painted white permanently placed as memorial for a victim of a road accident (usually cyclists).
10cm × 10cm brass plaque commemorating victims of Nazi persecution. (EU,RU)
A bench placed in memory of someone or something; usually has a plaque, and sometimes a statue sitting on (part of) it.

label.text: A farm within a bigger settlement
(please use isolated_dwelling for an isolated farm)
The top (summit) of a mountain or hill.
A saddle point between mountains or hills.
A persistent body of dense ice that is constantly moving under its own weight.
A volcano, either dormant, extinct or active.
A mountain or hill ridge.
A low area between hills.
A steep rock face exposure, with a significant vertical, or near vertical (leave the lower face to the right of the way).
The entrance to a cave.
A single tree.

list_entry.short_description: Trees remarkable due to its size or prominent location, usually visible from great distances and useful for navigation.
Especially old tree, often with a particular shape. Usually protected for its uniqueness.
Trees found within settlements, e.g. in parks or spread through residential areas.

label.text: A line of trees.
A single shrub.
An area of shrubbery that is actively maintained or pruned by humans.

list_entry.short_description: Sparsely planted shrubbery. Generally speaking able-bodied persons could walk through them (although this is usually not desirable).
Shrubbery with a medium density. Able-bodied persons might be able to barge through it, but it takes some effort and might result in scratches or soiled clothing.
Densely planted shrubbery. Effectively impassible without damaging the shrubbery (which at this point often acts as a hedge) and getting your clothes torn.

label.text: Woodland where timber production does not dominate use.
Where vegetation is dominated by grasses (Poaceae) and other herbaceous (non-woody) plants. Excludes cultivated areas and wetlands.
An accumulation of loose rocks.
An accumulation of loose rounded rocks on a beach or riverbed.
Bare upper lying uncultivated land principally covered with grass and often grazed.
Bare lower lying uncultivated land with bushes but little or no tree cover.
Bare lower lying uncultivated land with a shrubland habitat found mainly on free-draining infertile, acidic soils, and is characterised by open, low-growing woody vegetation.
Large area covered with sand.
For areas of solid visible rock that is sparsely vegetated or not vegetated at all.
A notable rock or group of rocks, with at least one of them firmly attached to the underlying bedrock.
A single notable free-standing rock, which may differ from the composition of the terrain it lies in.

combo.display_values: Almond trees,Apple trees,Apricot trees,Avocado trees,Banana plants,Blueberry plants,Cacao trees,Cherimoya trees,Cherry trees,Chestnut trees,Coconut palms,Coffea plants,Date palms,Hazel plants,Hop plants,Lemon trees,Macadamia trees,Mango trees,Oil palms,Olive trees,Orange trees,Papaya trees,Peach trees,Pear trees,Pecan trees,Persimmon trees,Pineapple plants,Pistachio trees,Pitaya plants,Plum trees,Pomegranate trees,Tea plants,Walnut trees
Chinese,Cottage garden,English,Flower garden,French,Herb garden,Japanese,Kitchen,Medical garden,Monastery,Rosarium,Walled garden,Zen

preset_link.text: Similar tags but different tagging schema:
Similar tags but different tagging schema:

label.text: A short text with additional information.
It might be viewable to the end user (perhaps using a search system or a map with pop-ups).
An important hint for other mappers (not for the end user).
A hint for other mappers (not for the end user), that an object needs an improvement.

text.javascript: function addCheckDate(key) { df = new java.text.SimpleDateFormat('yyyy-MM-dd'); v = new java.util.ArrayList(); v.add(df.format(new java.util.Date())); tags.put(key,v); } for (var key in Iterator(new java.util.HashSet(tags.keySet()))) { if (key.startsWith('check_date:')) { addCheckDate(key); } } addCheckDate('check_date'); tags.remove('automatic_check_date');

text.javascript: var objects = ['shop','amenity','leisure','military','man_made','tourism']; function isObject(key) { var objectsLength = objects.length; for (var i = 0; i < objectsLength; i++) { if (objects[i].equals(key)) { return true; } } return false; } for (var key in Iterator(new java.util.HashSet(tags.keySet()))) { if (isObject(key)) { tags.put('disused:'+key,tags.get(key)); tags.remove(key); } } tags.remove('set_to_disused');

var objects = ['shop','amenity','leisure','military']; function isObject(key) { var objectsLength = objects.length; for (var i = 0; i < objectsLength; i++) { if (objects[i].equals(key)) { return true; } } return false; } var presetItem = null; for (var key in Iterator(new java.util.HashSet(tags.keySet()))) { if (isObject(key)) { tags.put('disused:'+key,tags.get(key)); presetItem = key2PresetItem.get(key); tags.remove(key); } if (typeof versionCode !== 'undefined' && versionCode > 703) { if (presetItem !== null && presetItem.equals(key2PresetItem.get(key))) { tags.remove(key); } } } tags.remove('set_to_disused_remove_tags');
